description: From Latin digladiari, from di-, dis- + gladius (“a sword”).

verbs.description: digladiate (third-person singular simple present digladiates, present participle digladiating, simple past and past participle digladiated)

entries.meaning: (rare) To fight like gladiators; to contend or dispute violently.
examples: Digladiating, like Æschines and Demosthenes, they reciprocally lay open each other's filthiness to the view and scorn of the world.
